TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed RegistryValueKind extends System.Enum

remarks.para: The enumeration defines the set of supported registry data types and the value that is used for unsupported types (). Starting in the net_v40_long, you can specify not to use a data type with the value.
Use the method to determine the data type of a registry key value before retrieving the value. When you set a registry key value, use the method to specify the registry data type explicitly.

summary.para: Specifies the data types to use when storing values in the registry, or identifies the data type of a value in the registry.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind Binary = int32(3)

summary.para: Binary data in any form. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_BINARY.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind DWord = int32(4)

summary.para: A 32-bit binary number. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_DWORD.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind ExpandString = int32(2)

summary.para: A null-terminated string that contains unexpanded references to environment variables, such as %PATH%, that are expanded when the value is retrieved. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_EXPAND_SZ.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind MultiString = int32(7)

summary.para: An array of null-terminated strings, terminated by two null characters. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_MULTI_SZ.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind None = int32(-1)
.field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind QWord = int32(11)

summary.para: A 64-bit binary number. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_QWORD.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind String = int32(1)

summary.para: A null-terminated string. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_SZ.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind Unknown = int32(0)

summary.para: An unsupported registry data type. For example, the Microsoft Win32 API registry data type REG_RESOURCE_LIST is unsupported. Use this value to specify that the method should determine the appropriate registry data type when storing a name/value pair.
